Title: Exploring the Application of Large Language Models in Detecting and Protecting Personally Identifiable Information in Archival Data: A Comprehensive Study*
Abstract: this comprehensive study investigates the application of large language models  large language model  for detecting and protecting personally identifiable information  pii  in archival data a pressing concern for archives under the mandate to increase public access while safeguarding personal privacy. the paper juxtaposes traditional supervised learning methods against large language model‚äô unsupervised capabilities in pii detection unveiling large language model as viable alternatives capable of achieving satisfactory performance levels without the need for extensive training datasets. through empirical analysis the study validates the feasibility of large language model in identifying sensitive information within large volumes of archival material. the findings highlight large language model‚äô significant interpretability providing understandable rationale behind pii identification‚äîa feature that not only enhances trust in artificial intelliegence applications but also aids archival staff in the review process. this research contributes novel insights into the intersection of artificial intelliegence and archival science presenting large language model as powerful tools for addressing the twin challenges of data accessibility and privacy.
